title: gRPC starter app is using legacy approach, single HTTP server should be used instead
body:
### Describe the bug

gRPC starter app is using legacy approach, single HTTP server should be used instead 

Warning in the log: `WARN  [io.qua.grp.run.GrpcServerRecorder] (Quarkus Main Thread) Using legacy gRPC support, with separate new HTTP server instance. Switch to single HTTP server instance usage with quarkus.grpc.server.use-separate-server=false property`

```

2023-12-08 10:53:41,788 WARN  [io.qua.grp.run.GrpcServerRecorder] (Quarkus Main Thread) Using legacy gRPC support, with separate new HTTP server instance. Switch to single HTTP server instance usage with quarkus.grpc.server.use-separate-server=false property

2023-12-08 10:53:41,856 INFO  [io.qua.grp.run.GrpcServerRecorder] (Quarkus Main Thread) Registering gRPC reflection service
2023-12-08 10:53:42,008 INFO  [io.qua.grp.run.GrpcServerRecorder] (vert.x-eventloop-thread-0) Started gRPC server on 0.0.0.0:9000 [TLS enabled: false]
2023-12-08 10:53:42,048 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) code-with-quarkus 1.0.0-SNAPSHOT on JVM (powered by Quarkus 3.6.1) started in 2.193s. Listening on: http://localhost:8080
2023-12-08 10:53:42,050 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Profile dev activated. Live Coding activated.
2023-12-08 10:53:42,051 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Quarkus Main Thread) Installed features: [cdi, grpc-server, smallrye-context-propagation, vertx]
2023-12-08 10:53:47,022 INFO  [io.quarkus] (Shutdown thread) code-with-quarkus stopped in 0.017s
```

### Expected behavior

Suggested approach for gRPC is used in the starter code for the extension

### Actual behavior

Old approach for gRPC is used in the starter code for the extension

### How to Reproduce?

 - get app from https://code.quarkus.io/?e=grpc&extension-search=origin:platform%20grpc
 - run `mvn quarkus:dev`
 - check the logs

### Output of `uname -a` or `ver`

macOS

### Output of `java -version`

Java 17

### Quarkus version or git rev

3.6.1.Final

### Build tool (ie. output of `mvnw --version` or `gradlew --version`)

_No response_

_No response_
